sen.j: に公布され、翌に施行された大日本帝国憲法は4条で「天皇ハ國ノ元首ニシテ統治權ヲ總攬シ此ノ憲法ノ條規ニ依リテ之ヲ行フ」と定めた。
sen.e: The Constitution of the Empire of Japan, promulgated in 1889, taking effect the following year, stipulated in Article 4 that "the Emperor is the head of the state and holds all sovereignty but is to execute its authority according to the Articles of the Constitution."

sen.j: この条文の解釈や憲法全体の解釈運用にあたっては天皇主権（君権）を重んじる穂積八束や上杉慎吉ら君権学派（神権学派とも言う）と議会制を中心とした立憲主義を重んじる美濃部達吉や佐々木惣一ら立憲学派の二大学派に分かれて論じ合われた。
sen.e: The interpretation and operation for the overall Constitution was divided and discussed by two large schools; one is the the monarchism school, (also called the theocracy sect) led by Yatsuka HOZUMI and Shinkichi UESUGI etc., who valued imperial sovereignty (monarchism) and the other was the constitutional school, led by Tatsukichi MINOBE and Soichi SASAKI etc., who valued constitutionalism, with a focus on the parliament system.

sen.j: 憲法施行当初は超然主義を唱えた藩閥政治家や官僚らにより天皇主権を中心とした君権学派の解釈が重用された。
sen.e: Initially, when the Constitution took effect, interpretation by the monarch school sect focusing on imperial sovereignty, was valued by domain clique politicians and bureaucrats who promulgated the idea of the doctrine of superiority.

sen.j: 明治時代の終わりには上杉と美濃部の天皇機関説論争が行われ、大正デモクラシーの時期には立憲学派が優勢となった。
sen.e: At the end of the Meiji era, there was the emperor-as-organ theory argument between Uesugi and Minobe and constitutional school sect became predominant during the Taisho democracy.

sen.j: しかし、の天皇機関説事件で美濃部ら立憲学派が排撃され、同年に政府が発表した国体明徴声明では天皇主権を中心とした解釈が公定された。
sen.e: However, in the emperor-as-organ theory incident, constitutional school sect, led by Minobe, was driven out and interpretation focusing on imperial sovereignty was set in the statement of the fundamental character of the nation which was announced by the government in the same year.

sen.j: その後、に公布され、翌に施行された日本国憲法では日本国憲法前文及び日本国憲法第1条で国民主権が定められ、天皇主権は排された（日本国憲法第98条）。
sen.e: Afterwards, promulgated in 1946 and taking effect the following year, the Constitution of Japan set forth the sovereignty of the people in the preamble as well as Article 1, in turn, abolishing the imperial sovereignty.
